message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

The paper deals with 3D human pose estimation from monocular images, which is a computer vision problem. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel representation learning approach using an auto-encoder model, which involves training a neural network, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also introduces a learning-based representation consistency constraint, which involves optimizing the model's performance, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another possible sub-category. The paper also deals with 3D geometry and uses a skeleton-based encoder-decoder mechanism, making cs.GR (Graphics) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves experiments on three popular benchmarks, which involves evaluating the model's performance, making cs.MM (Multimedia) another possible sub-category.
